definition[0]: to include or put on something extra
example[0]: proposals to add a penny on income tax
example[1]: The private chapel was added on to the church much later.
definition[1]: something extra that is added to an existing plan, agreement, law etc
example[2]: We bought legal protection as an add-on to our home insurance policy.
definition[2]: a piece of equipment that you connect to a computer to improve its performance
definition[3]: a product that is designed to be used with another product
definition[4]: a product that is sold to be used with another product
example[4]: You can have legal insurance as an add-on to a household policy.
definition[5]: a piece of equipment or software that you connect to a computer, usually in order to improve its performance
example[5]: We’ve compiled an extensive list of add-ons to make browsing with Internet Explorer more productive.
